Poke.Name: bulbasaur
Poke.FlavourText: Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun’s rays, the seed grows progressively larger.

Poke.Name: ivysaur
Poke.FlavourText: There is a bud on this Pokémon’s back. To support its weight, Ivysaur’s legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it’s a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.

Poke.Name: venusaur
Poke.FlavourText: There is a large flower on Venusaur’s back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower’s aroma soothes the emotions of people.

Poke.Name: charmander
Poke.FlavourText: The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.

Poke.Name: charmeleon
Poke.FlavourText: Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.

Poke.Name: charizard
Poke.FlavourText: Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.

Poke.Name: squirtle
Poke.FlavourText: Squirtle’s shell is not merely used for protection. The shell’s rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.

Poke.Name: wartortle
Poke.FlavourText: Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon’s toughness as a battler.

Poke.Name: blastoise
Poke.FlavourText: Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.

Poke.Name: caterpie
Poke.FlavourText: It’s easy to catch, and it grows quickly, making it one of the top recommendations for novice Pokémon Trainers.

Poke.Name: metapod
Poke.FlavourText: Its shell is hard, but it’s still just a bug shell. It’s been known to break, so intense battles with it should be avoided.

Poke.Name: butterfree
Poke.FlavourText: When attacked by other Pokémon, it defends itself by scattering its poisonous scales and fluttering its wings.

Poke.Name: weedle
Poke.FlavourText: Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).

Poke.Name: kakuna
Poke.FlavourText: Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.

Poke.Name: beedrill
Poke.FlavourText: Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.

Poke.Name: pidgey
Poke.FlavourText: Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.

Poke.Name: pidgeotto
Poke.FlavourText: Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.

Poke.Name: pidgeot
Poke.FlavourText: This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.

Poke.Name: rattata
Poke.FlavourText: With their strong capacity for survival, they can live in dirty places without concern. Left unchecked, their numbers multiply rapidly.

Poke.Name: raticate
Poke.FlavourText: Its disposition is far more violent than its looks would suggest. Don’t let your hand get too close to its face, as it could bite your hand clean off.

Poke.Name: spearow
Poke.FlavourText: Farmers whose fields are troubled by bug Pokémon appreciate Spearow for its vigorous appetite and look after it.

Poke.Name: fearow
Poke.FlavourText: Drawings of a Pokémon resembling Fearow can be seen in murals from deep in ancient history.

Poke.Name: ekans
Poke.FlavourText: Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.

Poke.Name: arbok
Poke.FlavourText: This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.

Poke.Name: pikachu
Poke.FlavourText: It’s in its nature to store electricity. It feels stressed now and then if it’s unable to fully discharge the electricity.

Poke.Name: raichu
Poke.FlavourText: It becomes aggressive when it has electricity stored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to take care to avoid being attacked.

Poke.Name: sandshrew
Poke.FlavourText: It usually makes its home in deserts and arid zones, where rain does not fall. It digs holes to catch Bug-type Pokémon.

Poke.Name: sandslash
Poke.FlavourText: It uses its claws to climb trees and then curls its body into a spiny ball, ready to drop onto any prey that appears.

Poke.Name: nidoran-f
Poke.FlavourText: Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.

Poke.Name: nidorina
Poke.FlavourText: When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.

Poke.Name: nidoqueen
Poke.FlavourText: Nidoqueen’s body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.

Poke.Name: nidoran-m
Poke.FlavourText: Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon’s notice.

Poke.Name: nidorino
Poke.FlavourText: Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.

Poke.Name: nidoking
Poke.FlavourText: Nidoking’s thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.

Poke.Name: clefairy
Poke.FlavourText: On nights with a full moon, they gather together and dance. The surrounding area is enveloped in an abnormal magnetic field.

Poke.Name: clefable
Poke.FlavourText: According to tradition, people who see a pair of Clefable skipping by can look forward to a happy marriage.

Poke.Name: vulpix
Poke.FlavourText: From its mouth spew flames that seem to resemble the spirits of the deceased. Some people mistakenly think this fire is a ghost.

Poke.Name: ninetales
Poke.FlavourText: Said to live for a thousand years, this Pokémon uses its supernatural abilities to manipulate fire. It can burn its prey to a crisp as it pleases.

Poke.Name: jigglypuff
Poke.FlavourText: Jigglypuff possess a vocal range that exceeds 12 octaves, but each individual’s singing skill depends on its own effort.

Poke.Name: wigglytuff
Poke.FlavourText: As it inhales, it expands...and expands...and expands. Wigglytuff compete to see which one can inflate itself the most.

Poke.Name: zubat
Poke.FlavourText: When exposed to sunlight, they suffer burns. The frequency of their ultrasonic waves can differ slightly from colony to colony.

Poke.Name: golbat
Poke.FlavourText: Sometimes they drink so much blood, they can’t fly anymore. Then they fall to the ground and become food for other Pokémon.

Poke.Name: oddish
Poke.FlavourText: Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon’s feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.

Poke.Name: gloom
Poke.FlavourText: From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.

Poke.Name: vileplume
Poke.FlavourText: Vileplume has the world’s largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.

Poke.Name: paras
Poke.FlavourText: Mushrooms called tochukaso sprout from its back. They can be dried and powdered to make a medicine used to extend life.

Poke.Name: parasect
Poke.FlavourText: It scatters toxic spores from its mushroom cap. Once harvested, these spores can be steeped and boiled down to prepare herbal medicines.

Poke.Name: venonat
Poke.FlavourText: Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.

Poke.Name: venomoth
Poke.FlavourText: Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.

Poke.Name: diglett
Poke.FlavourText: Many farmers cherish and nurture Diglett because its droppings enrich the soil it lives in.

Poke.Name: dugtrio
Poke.FlavourText: Despite the closeness between this Pokémon and farmers and other people, no one has ever seen the parts of it concealed underground.

Poke.Name: meowth
Poke.FlavourText: It loves shiny things. It often fights with Murkrow over prey they’re both trying to catch.

Poke.Name: persian
Poke.FlavourText: It has a high opinion of itself, although not to the same extent as the Alolan Persian. It’s quite difficult to make friends with this Pokémon.

Poke.Name: psyduck
Poke.FlavourText: This Pokémon is troubled by constant headaches. The more pain it’s in, the more powerful its psychokinesis becomes.

Poke.Name: golduck
Poke.FlavourText: It swims along the banks of lakes and catches fish Pokémon. It takes them to the shore and quietly eats them up.

Poke.Name: mankey
Poke.FlavourText: Its raging tires it out and causes it to fall asleep, but the anger resonating in its dreams causes it to wake up—which infuriates it all over again.

Poke.Name: primeape
Poke.FlavourText: Some researchers theorize that Primeape remains angry even when inside a Poké Ball.

Poke.Name: growlithe
Poke.FlavourText: It looks cute, but when you approach another Trainer’s Growlithe, it will bark at you and bite.

Poke.Name: arcanine
Poke.FlavourText: The fire burning inside its body serves as the energy to fuel it as it runs great distances. It appears in many legends.

Poke.Name: poliwag
Poke.FlavourText: It’s still not very good at walking. Its Trainers should train this Pokémon to walk every day.

Poke.Name: poliwhirl
Poke.FlavourText: It marches over the land in search of bug Pokémon to eat. Then it takes them underwater so it can dine on them where it’s safe.

Poke.Name: poliwrath
Poke.FlavourText: Its percentage of body fat is nearly zero. Its body is entirely muscle, which makes it heavy and forces its swimming prowess to develop.

Poke.Name: abra
Poke.FlavourText: It can teleport itself to safety while it’s asleep, but when it wakes, it doesn’t know where it is, so it panics.

Poke.Name: kadabra
Poke.FlavourText: Kadabra’s presence infests televisions and monitors with creepy shadows that bring bad luck.

Poke.Name: alakazam
Poke.FlavourText: Its brain cells continue to increase in number until its death. The older the Alakazam, the larger its head.

Poke.Name: machop
Poke.FlavourText: With its superhuman strength, it’s able to throw a hundred people all at the same time. Its strength comes from lifting Graveler every day.

Poke.Name: machoke
Poke.FlavourText: It willingly assists with hard labor because it knows the work is good training for its muscles.

Poke.Name: machamp
Poke.FlavourText: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.

Poke.Name: bellsprout
Poke.FlavourText: Bellsprout’s thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.

Poke.Name: weepinbell
Poke.FlavourText: Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.

Poke.Name: victreebel
Poke.FlavourText: Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.

Poke.Name: tentacool
Poke.FlavourText: It drifts in shallow seas, such as the areas near beaches. If you get bitten or stabbed by its toxic tentacles, rush to the hospital.

Poke.Name: tentacruel
Poke.FlavourText: Although these Pokémon are rare, when a large outbreak of them occurs, all fish Pokémon disappear from the surrounding sea.

Poke.Name: geodude
Poke.FlavourText: There are plenty of them to be found along any road. A scholar with too much free time once counted a hundred of them along a single route.

Poke.Name: graveler
Poke.FlavourText: This slow-footed Pokémon moves by curling up and rolling instead of walking. With enough momentum, its speed can exceed 60 mph.

Poke.Name: golem
Poke.FlavourText: Once a year, this Pokémon molts, and its shed shell returns to the soil. This process creates enriched soil, so farmers collect the shells.

Poke.Name: ponyta
Poke.FlavourText: Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.

Poke.Name: rapidash
Poke.FlavourText: Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.

Poke.Name: slowpoke
Poke.FlavourText: Alolan home cooking involves drying Slowpoke tails and then simmering them into a salty stew.

Poke.Name: slowbro
Poke.FlavourText: Whenever Shellder bites down hard on its tail, it gives Slowbro a flash of inspiration...which it forgets a moment later.

Poke.Name: magnemite
Poke.FlavourText: It sends out electromagnetic waves, which let it float through the air. Touching it while it’s eating electricity will give you a full-body shock.

Poke.Name: magneton
Poke.FlavourText: It has about three times the electrical power of Magnemite. For some reason, outbreaks of this Pokémon happen when lots of sunspots appear.

Poke.Name: farfetchd
Poke.FlavourText: Farfetch’d is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.

Poke.Name: doduo
Poke.FlavourText: Doduo’s two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.

Poke.Name: dodrio
Poke.FlavourText: Apparently, the heads aren’t the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.

Poke.Name: seel
Poke.FlavourText: Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.

Poke.Name: dewgong
Poke.FlavourText: Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.

Poke.Name: grimer
Poke.FlavourText: It was born from sludge transformed by exposure to X-rays from the moon. When its internal load of germs decreases, it dies.

Poke.Name: muk
Poke.FlavourText: After recent environmental improvements, this Pokémon is now hardly seen at all. People speculate that it may go extinct at some point.

Poke.Name: shellder
Poke.FlavourText: This Pokémon’s tongue is always hanging out. It uses its tongue with great dexterity to dig up sand from the seabed in its search for food.

Poke.Name: cloyster
Poke.FlavourText: Excavation of the tombs of ancient hunting tribes has turned up many spears tipped with spikes that had fallen off this Pokémon’s shell.

Poke.Name: gastly
Poke.FlavourText: Although Gastly is barely visible, when it’s near, a faint sweet smell lingers.

Poke.Name: haunter
Poke.FlavourText: It fears the light and revels in the dark. It may be on the verge of extinction in cities that stay brightly lit at night.

Poke.Name: gengar
Poke.FlavourText: It apparently wishes for a traveling companion. Since it was once human itself, it tries to create one by taking the lives of other humans.

Poke.Name: onix
Poke.FlavourText: Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.

Poke.Name: drowzee
Poke.FlavourText: It finds really fun dreams tasty. When it makes friends with people, it may show them the most delicious dreams it’s ever eaten.

Poke.Name: hypno
Poke.FlavourText: As a matter of course, it makes anyone it meets fall asleep and has a taste of their dreams. Anyone having a good dream, it carries off.

Poke.Name: krabby
Poke.FlavourText: Krabby live on beaches, burrowed inside holes dug into the sand. On sandy beaches with little in the way of food, these Pokémon can be seen squabbling with each other over territory.

Poke.Name: kingler
Poke.FlavourText: Kingler has an enormous, oversized claw. It waves this huge claw in the air to communicate with others. However, because the claw is so heavy, the Pokémon quickly tires.

Poke.Name: voltorb
Poke.FlavourText: Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.

Poke.Name: electrode
Poke.FlavourText: One of Electrode’s characteristics is its attraction to electricity. It is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just been generated.

Poke.Name: exeggcute
Poke.FlavourText: Six of them together form a full-fledged Pokémon. It’s often hunted by Crabrawler, but uses psychokinesis to drive it off.

Poke.Name: exeggutor
Poke.FlavourText: When the time comes, one of its three heads falls off. Before long, the fallen head grows into an Exeggcute.

Poke.Name: cubone
Poke.FlavourText: The skull it wears on its head is that of its dead mother. According to some, it will evolve when it comes to terms with the pain of her death.

Poke.Name: marowak
Poke.FlavourText: This Pokémon is out for vengeance on its natural enemy, Mandibuzz. It throws bones like boomerangs to try to take it down.

Poke.Name: hitmonlee
Poke.FlavourText: Hitmonlee’s legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.

Poke.Name: hitmonchan
Poke.FlavourText: Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.

Poke.Name: lickitung
Poke.FlavourText: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.

Poke.Name: koffing
Poke.FlavourText: Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.

Poke.Name: weezing
Poke.FlavourText: Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.

Poke.Name: rhyhorn
Poke.FlavourText: Rhyhorn’s brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.

Poke.Name: rhydon
Poke.FlavourText: Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.

Poke.Name: chansey
Poke.FlavourText: Not only are these Pokémon fast runners, they’re also few in number, so anyone who finds one must be lucky indeed.

Poke.Name: tangela
Poke.FlavourText: Tangela’s vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.

Poke.Name: kangaskhan
Poke.FlavourText: The child in its pouch leaves home after roughly three years. That is the only time the mother is heard to cry wildly.

Poke.Name: horsea
Poke.FlavourText: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.

Poke.Name: seadra
Poke.FlavourText: Seadra generates whirlpools by spinning its body. The whirlpools are strong enough to swallow even fishing boats. This Pokémon weakens prey with these currents, then swallows it whole.

Poke.Name: goldeen
Poke.FlavourText: Spellbound by the length of its horn and the beauty of its fins, many strange Trainers raise Goldeen and nothing but Goldeen.

Poke.Name: seaking
Poke.FlavourText: Trainers who are crazy for Seaking are divided into horn enthusiasts and fin enthusiasts. The two groups do not get along well.

Poke.Name: staryu
Poke.FlavourText: This Pokémon gets nibbled on by Lumineon and others. Thanks to its red core, it regenerates fast, so it’s unconcerned by their snack attacks.

Poke.Name: starmie
Poke.FlavourText: Its unusual body shape, reminiscent of abstract art, led local people to spread rumors that this Pokémon may be an invader from outer space.

Poke.Name: mr-mime
Poke.FlavourText: Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.

Poke.Name: scyther
Poke.FlavourText: While young, they live together deep in the mountains, training themselves in how to fight with their scythes and move at high speeds.

Poke.Name: jynx
Poke.FlavourText: Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.

Poke.Name: electabuzz
Poke.FlavourText: Electricity leaks from it in amounts far greater than the amount of electricity it eats.

Poke.Name: magmar
Poke.FlavourText: When angered, it spouts brilliant fire from all over its body. It doesn’t calm down until its opponent has burned to ash.

Poke.Name: pinsir
Poke.FlavourText: One solid blow from its horns is enough to split apart a large tree. Its greatest rival in Alola is Vikavolt.

Poke.Name: tauros
Poke.FlavourText: Although it’s known to be a fierce Pokémon, Tauros in the Alola region are said to possess a measure of calmness.

Poke.Name: magikarp
Poke.FlavourText: Its reckless leaps make it easy pickings for predators. On the bright side, many Pokémon enjoy longer life spans, thanks to Magikarp.

Poke.Name: gyarados
Poke.FlavourText: There are people who swear that any place Gyarados appears is fated for destruction.

Poke.Name: lapras
Poke.FlavourText: These Pokémon were once near extinction due to poaching. Following protective regulations, there is now an overabundance of them.

Poke.Name: ditto
Poke.FlavourText: With its astonishing capacity for metamorphosis, it can get along with anything. It does not get along well with its fellow Ditto.

Poke.Name: eevee
Poke.FlavourText: Current studies show it can evolve into an incredible eight different species of Pokémon.

Poke.Name: vaporeon
Poke.FlavourText: Blending in with the water and erasing all signs of its presence, it patiently waits for its prey, fish Pokémon.

Poke.Name: jolteon
Poke.FlavourText: When its fur stands on end, that’s a sign it’s about to give off a jolt of electricity. Take care, as sometimes lightning strikes next to it, too.

Poke.Name: flareon
Poke.FlavourText: Its average body temperature is between 1,300 and 1,500 degrees Fahrenheit. In its internal flame sac, temperatures reach 3,000 degrees.

Poke.Name: porygon
Poke.FlavourText: It can convert its body into digital data, which enables it to enter cyberspace.

Poke.Name: omanyte
Poke.FlavourText: Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.

Poke.Name: omastar
Poke.FlavourText: Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.

Poke.Name: kabuto
Poke.FlavourText: Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for 300 million years.

Poke.Name: kabutops
Poke.FlavourText: Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.

Poke.Name: aerodactyl
Poke.FlavourText: In ancient times, it ruled the skies. A widely accepted theory is that it went extinct due to a large meteor impact.

Poke.Name: snorlax
Poke.FlavourText: It eats nearly 900 pounds of food every day. It starts nodding off while eating—and continues to eat even while it’s asleep.

Poke.Name: articuno
Poke.FlavourText: Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.

Poke.Name: zapdos
Poke.FlavourText: Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.

Poke.Name: moltres
Poke.FlavourText: Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.

Poke.Name: dratini
Poke.FlavourText: After a 10-hour struggle, a fisherman was able to pull one up and confirm its existence.

Poke.Name: dragonair
Poke.FlavourText: From time immemorial, it has been venerated by agricultural peoples as an entity able to control the weather.

Poke.Name: dragonite
Poke.FlavourText: Incur the wrath of this normally calm Pokémon at your peril, because it will smash everything to smithereens before it’s satisfied.

Poke.Name: mewtwo
Poke.FlavourText: Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon’s body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.

Poke.Name: mew
Poke.FlavourText: Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
